intro: Maytenus evonymoides, commonly known as the Mexican privet, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its opposite, simple, ovate leaves that are usually dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in axillary clusters, followed by small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types. However, it can be invasive in some regions, outcompeting native vegetation.
